entry.title: Refactor FileType.getTypeFromName() into base file
entry.content:
We will soon be changing ImageLoader to have a smaller

imageLoaderPrivate API rather than fileManagerPrivate. ImageLoader

imports FileType.getTypeFromName() from file_type.js which imports files

which reference fileManagerPrivate.



Putting this function into file_types_base.js with no deps on

fileManagerPrivate means that the rollup process will not pull in any

code that refers to fileManagerPrivate.



Bug: b/293534917

Change-Id: Ib3f216dd41c6bffe9b621d32795b10d96ae19bef

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4736831

Commit-Queue: Joel Hockey

Reviewed-by: Luciano Pacheco

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178160}

entry.title: Scalable Notifiers: update launching for settings CTAs
entry.content:
Update the CTAs related to opening a settings subpage to launch using

SettingsWindowManager to avoid opening via subpage urls. Using

SettingsWindowManager will remove the need to directly specify/handle

url specifics for the settings subpage paths.



This fixes the printer and phone hub CTA crash issue on specific glinux

builds. The crash was resulting from a settings subpage path check.



Bug: b/293956407

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in AlternateProtocolServerPropertiesTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



net:net_unittests/AlternateProtocolServerPropertiesTest.EmptyVector

146 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

94 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Move bulk pinning to hidden by default
entry.content:
The information for bulk pinning available at chrome://drive-internals

contains a lot of sensitive data mainly used for debugging. This CL

moves it all to show only when developer mode is enabled except the max

queue size which can be used to provide a lever to throttle the max

number of pins to alleviate CPU pressure.

entry.title: float: Reverse float button on `Alt` press
entry.content:
When `Alt` pressed, clicking float button will float the window to the

bottom left. If the button is already floated, then pattern will still

update but unfloating will do the same thing as before. With this patch,

reverse float works with windows with ash-frames. A follow up will

incorporate lacros.



Needed to make some changes to the current `MultitaskButton` logic as

well to accommodate. The buttons now scale if the button size changes in

the future.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Add support for try-decode-later for V4L2StatefulVD
entry.content:
ToT V4L2StatefulVD rejects Decode() calls when the |OUTPUT_queue_| is

full. This CL supports trying later by storing the DecoderBuffer and

DecodeCB pair in a queue, and trying enqueuing any such stored couple

when we get decoded pictures out @TryAndDequeueCAPTUREQueueBuffers().



The actual code for enqueuing is refactored into a new method

TryAndEnqueueOUTPUTQueueBuffers().



With this VP9 group0 files are correctly decoded on trogdor.

entry.title: Only fetch courses to determine if user uses classroom
entry.content:
When determining whether the user is enrolled in a Google Classroom

course, it's sufficient to fetch the list of courses where the user is

a student/teacher. This refactors methods that determine whether the

users is a student or a teacher in a classroom course not to fetch

full set of user course work data - this shortens the time before

glanceables bubble can be shown, so users have better indication that

classroom data is available (and loading) sooner.



This requires the courses fetch state to be untangled from overall

course work data fetch state. With this change, course list fetch

maintains it's own state machine that tracks fetch state of a course

list, and fetching course list becomes the first step in the overall

user data state machine.



BUG=b/291991506



Change-Id: I380f1d03312b90de885d9e22a2493e3461179ef5

entry.title: In monochrome AVIF, ignore the matrixCoefficients
entry.content:
To convert monochrome AVIF to RGB, we can just set the R, G, B channels

to the Y channel. We don't really need to use the matrixCoefficients.

This avoids having to handle matrixCoefficients=0 (Identity) as a

special case.

entry.title: Allow SelectAroundCaret to select symbols.
entry.content:
Currently, FrameSelection::GetSelectionRangeAroundCaret does not allow

selection ranges that start with a separator character. However, it

uses a definition of IsSeparator that includes symbols such as emojis,

which means that these sorts of characters can't be selected.



This CL modifies the definition of IsSeparator to exclude symbols, which

should be ok since this is the only place IsSeparator is used. It also

relaxes the selection range condition so that text starting with a

separator character can be selected if it contains at least one

non-separator character. Note that SelectAroundCaret will still prefer

to select non-empty text that does not start with a separator character,

as is current behaviour.



Bug: b:286349199

Change-Id: I26d3e690ef8019b990f344bf4eb9278246bafe8a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4714428

entry.title: [PriceInsights] Fix bugs
entry.content:
This CL fixes the following bugs:

* The omnibox icon remained on navigation. We should reset the icon on

every navigation.

* On icon click, if the side panel is already open, we should close it

instead of no-op.

* When parsing the proto, the field presence check hasXXX isn't reliable

since we use proto3 on backend. Add more checks to avoid this.

* In the history graph, when converting a string to the Date type, we

should use the Date(year, month, day) constructor to avoid compilation

errors.

Original change's description:

> [infra] Generate a separate shadow properties file.

>

> In order to support using led real builds with CI builders, the

> $build/reclient property needs to be changed to use the untrusted

> instance of reclient. Buildbucket has support for shadow properties

> added, but for bootstrapped builders, the shadow properties end up being

> overridden when the bootstrapper loads the properties from the

> properties file.

>

> https://crrev.com/c/4730320 will add support for a shadow properties

> file, the properties of which will override the properties from the

> regular properties file when a shadow build is being performed. This

> change creates the shadow properties files for bootstrapped builders.

entry.title: Deprecated shutdown metrics V1
entry.content:
The V1 set of metrics were using the local state prefs to keep

the shutdown metrics until the next startup where they will be

reported.



A recent change in Chrome fixed the persistent memory for metrics.

This means that UMA metrics macros are now working during shutdown.



The V2 metrics are landed for months and are stable. We can deprecate

the V1 set of metrics.



Deprecate UMA metrics:

* Shutdown.NotValid.Time

* Shutdown.SilentExit.Time

* Shutdown.WindowClose.Time

* Shutdown.BrowserExit.Time

* Shutdown.EndSession.Time

* Shutdown.OtherExit.Time



Deprecate the shutdown time file:

* chrome_shutdown_ms.txt



Deprecate local state prefs:

* shutdown.num_processes

* shutdown.num_processes_slow"



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS="Shutdown Metrics V1 are replaced by Shutdown Metrics V2"



Bug: 1456205, 1468093

Change-Id: I1a48b5b3e0b5791ef53152448c8cd096471d6308

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4734233

entry.title: Fenced frames: add WPT for scrollIntoView() bubbling.
entry.content:
This CL adds an external WPT to ensure that calling scrollIntoView()

inside a fenced frame does not cause its embedder to scroll as well.



This is needed for our spec work. We currently have the

`ScrollIntoViewFencedFrameBrowserTest` browser test, but we need to

create a version that can be added to our spec.

entry.title: [dPWA] Remove NOTREACHED() behavior in web_app_shortcut_win
entry.content:
This CL removes the NOTREACHED() in CreateShortcutsInPaths() and

directly returns false instead. The reasoning for silently

tackling this is somewhat similar to crbug.com/1409695, i.e.

while this is a rare case, it is not alarming enough to crash

with a NOTREACHED(), and silently returning a success rate of

false should be enough.

entry.content:
This test verifies that GetNetworkList behaves identically when

executing on a network service hosted in different sandbox configurations



On platforms that support a sandbox, the result of GetNetworkList

is compared between the sandbox being disabled and sandbox enabled.



Additionally, on Windows, the LPAC sandbox is compared with the

AppContainer sandbox.

entry.title: Consolidate Suggestion Image retrieval.
entry.content:
The change moves image retrieval from Answer and Entity suggestions to

OmniboxImageSupplier class.



- ImageFetcher is moved to OmniboxImageSupplier class,

- Logic aggregating multiple requests for the same resource is

consolidated,

- Tests covering above scenarios are moved to

OmniboxImageSupplierUnitTest,

- We no longer use ENTITY_ and ANSWER_SUGGESITON_UMA_CLIENT_NAME:

this distinction is about to lose its meaning, and will be handled

separately (all suggestions are about to be eligible to show image

decorations).

entry.title: Add MSI tagging functionality to the tagging tool, simplify command line
entry.content:
This CL:

* adds MSI tagging functionality to the tagging tool.

* renames the tool to `tag.exe`.

* simplifies the command line, with `--set-tag` and `--get-tag`.

* removes `tag.py`, which is no longer needed.



Example usage for MSI installers:

```

out\Default\tag.exe

--set-tag="appguid=FOO_BAR_APP_ID&appname=SomeName&needsadmin=prefers"

--out=out\Default\FooBar.tagged.msi

out\Default\FooBar.msi

```



Example usage for EXE installers:

```

out\Default\tag.exe

--set-tag="appguid=FOO_BAR_APP_ID&appname=SomeName&needsadmin=prefers"

--out=out\Default\FooBar.tagged.exe

out\Default\FooBar.exe

```



Bug: 1465914

entry.title: Use InlinedVector in /components/feedback
entry.content:
Replace usages of base::StackVector with absl::InlinedVector. This is

not a pure rename, as the semantics are slightly different:



1. Methods like push_back() which were accessed with the -> operator in

StackVector are instead accessed with . with InlinedVector.



See also discussion thread in cxx@chromium.org:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/jTfqVfU-Ka0/m/caaal90NCgAJ



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Allow gnrt build artifacts to be cached
entry.content:
gnrt_stdlib.py unconditionally re-fetches the rust sources,

re-downloads the beta toolchain, and re-builds gnrt. This leads to

long edit-test cycles.



Add option to skip these steps, and option to use a specified artifact

dir instead of a temporary dir. Re-running the script with these

options will consequently just run gnrt again without rebuilding it.

entry.title: Omit frame pointers in Skia's Raster Pipeline
entry.content:
Skia's RP performs CPU shading with a series of tail-called

"stages". Each stage is relatively short - often just a few

instructions. In this system, the frame-pointer overhead is

significant. We've shown this in Skia benchmarks, and would

like to measure the impact on Chrome's rendering speed.



We propose landing, then reverting this CL. Pinpoint will

detect any regressions. Depending on the outcome of that,

we can assess the value of landing this permanently.



Bug: 1409835

Change-Id: I9a4f24c30de0df829bf6a468e0793e1446e59b3e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4739492

Reviewed-by: Herb Derby

Commit-Queue: Brian Osman

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178019}

entry.title: Refactor FLEDGE WPTs to use Python bidding/decision logic handlers.
entry.content:
Previously, bidding and decision logic functions were loaded from static

JS files, which limited their utility; the more configuration we wanted

in the tests, the more static files we had to write. This change

replaces the static *.js and *.js.headers files with Python that

generates the same code (except with imperfect formatting).



The Python handlers are configurable with URL parameters. This means

that whenever we want to configurea FLEDGE test to do something new,

we can just provide a URL param to the Python handler, which can use

it to modify the JS under test.



Change-Id: I980f87074379e6acb8608bf552e9fa775576d3ca

entry.title: Calculate submenu metrics each time a menu is shown or modified.
entry.content:
The old code recursed through all submenus when the top-level menu was

shown. This doesn't work for bookmark menus, which are lazily populated

as the user navigates through them. Instead, compute metrics for only

the current menu, but do it whenever necessary.



Along the way this cleans up what were a variety of separate methods to

be more unified (and efficient), so people can't forget to do part of

it.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Using Metrics Provider
entry.content:
Using metrics::MetricsProvider class to automate the recording of

metrics to the histogram

ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.DeviceLifetime2.{time}

instead of manually recording them when a user changes a setting.

This will ensure that every person using Settings would be represented

in the histograms no matter if they have used a new unique Settings

recently or not.



dd: go/cros-settings-revamp-metrics-design-doc



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=The requirements for the histogram ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.DeviceLifetime.{Time} has changed, we will now use ChromeOS.Settings.NumUniqueSettingsChanged.DeviceLifetime2.{Time}. We will now record the number periodically, regardless of whether they have changed a unique Setting or not.





BUG=b/291140047

TEST=

Manual:

Every 30 minutes, there will be a call to log metrics.

To decrease the time interval, add flag

--metrics-upload-interval=20 to /etc/chrome_dev.conf.



Automated:

1. --gtest_filter="*PerSessionSettingsUserActionTrackerTest*"

2. --gtest_filter="*ChromeMetricsServiceClientTest*"

entry.title: Add jelly to dependency list for time-of-day.
entry.content:
There are no functional changes introduced here. Time-of-day

has always depended on jelly. We've just been enforcing that

manually. This adds the dependency to code for safety reasons.



The biggest change here is adding that dependency to tests and

making sure that all of the tests only exercise feature

combinations that are possible in the real world (ex: it is

impossible for time-of-day to be enabled without jelly).

entry.title: Fix shutdown hang related to SendFinancialPing
entry.content:
The cause of the hang is because the event is not signaled on an

error path.



The hang is caused by a long timeout (a.k.a 5 minutes) on a sequence

with shutdown behavior "SKIP_ON_SHUTDOWN" but there is no other thread

that will signal the event.



R=gab@chromium.org

entry.title: rgbkbd: wallpaper color validity metric update
entry.content:
Previously the metric is emitted even when the wallpaper color is not

yet available, causing the data to report inaccurate invalid results.

This CL replaces this metric with a new one that is emitted only when

the wallpaper color is present.

entry.title: Fix rounded corner radii + shadows for go/continuous-overview-animation.
entry.content:
Clean up + fix logic for showing shadows.



Don’t show rounded corners when entering overview mode on tablet mode.

This prevents OverviewSessionTest.RoundedCornersVisibility from failing

when the feature ContinuousOverviewAnimation is enabled.



Add unit test to ensure proper behavior of corner radii and shadows

during a continuous scroll.



Test: ash_unittests
